plugin.name: â± Habits and Summaries
plugin.description: Generate summaries from notes for a given time period, or save search results, and save to notes. Requires configuring to suit your use of NotePlan. Click link for more details and settings.
plugin.author: Jonathan Clark
plugin.lastUpdateInfo: Plugin and some command names have changed! Also added several new features -- please look at the CHANGELOG and README. Now allows @mention as Did/Didn't terms.

plugin.commands.name: insertProgressUpdate
plugin.commands.description: Insert weekly/monthly habit and progress update

plugin.commands.name: periodStats
plugin.commands.description: Generate counts (and other stats) of tags and mentions for a time period

plugin.commands.name: weeklyStatsToCSV
plugin.commands.description: Generate stats for tags and mentions for all weeks this year, and write CSV to a note

plugin.settings.title: Folders to exclude
plugin.settings.description: List of folders to exclude in these commands. May be empty. (Note that @Trash, @Templates and @Archive are always excluded.)

plugin.settings.title: Include sparkline graphs?
plugin.settings.description:
Where appropriate, this adds basic ASCII-art sparklines for each item, reflecting each day's data.
Note: Sparklines won't be shown where the summarised time period is more than a month.

plugin.settings.title: Heading level
plugin.settings.description: Heading level (1-5) to use when writing headings to notes

plugin.settings.title: What time period should the Progress update cover?
plugin.settings.description:
Pick one of the options: 'wtd' (week to date), 'userwtd' (user's week to date), 'last7d' (last 7 days), 'mtd' (month to date), 'last2w' (last 2 weeks), 'last4w' (last 4 weeks).
(This can be overriden when called from a Template by setting the relevant parameter.)

plugin.settings.title: Where to write the progress update?
plugin.settings.description:
Write to 'current' note, or to the current 'daily' or 'weekly' note.
(If the progress update section already exists, it will be updated, rather than be repeated.)

plugin.settings.title: Progress heading
plugin.settings.description: Heading to go before Progress Update output

plugin.settings.title: #hashtags to count
plugin.settings.description: List of #hashtags to include in Progress updates. If this list is empty, no hashtags will be included.

plugin.settings.title: @mentions to count
plugin.settings.description: List of @mentions to include in Progress updates. If this list is empty, no mentions will be included.

plugin.settings.title: Did/Didn't Do items
plugin.settings.description: Comma-separated list of #hashtags and/or @mentions to track by being present or not 'did I do it this day or not?'.

plugin.settings.title: Folder name
plugin.settings.description: Folder to store the summaries in

plugin.settings.title: Stats heading
plugin.settings.description: Heading to go before progressResults' output section

plugin.settings.title: Hashtag counts heading
plugin.settings.description: (Optional) Heading to go before section of #hashtag stats

plugin.settings.title: Mention counts heading
plugin.settings.description: (Optional) Heading to go before section of @mention stats

plugin.settings.title: Show hashtag or mention as links?
plugin.settings.description: Whether to show the # or @ symbols, or hide them to stop them being active links. (Beware double counting if you turn this on and save results in daily notes.)

plugin.settings.title: #hashtags to include
plugin.settings.description: List of #hashtags to include in counts (e.g. '#holiday', '#jog', '#commute', '#webinar'). If empty, none will be included.
plugin.settings.description_: List of #hashtags to include in counts (e.g. '#holiday', '#jog', '#commute', '#webinar'). These take precedence over any excluded hashtags (next field). If this list is empty, all hashtags will be included.

plugin.settings.title: #hashtags to exclude
plugin.settings.description: List of #hashtags to exclude in counts. If empty, none will be excluded.

plugin.settings.title: @mentions to include
plugin.settings.description: List of @mentions to include in counts (e.g. '@work', '@fruitveg', '@water', '@sleep'). If empty, none will be included.
plugin.settings.description_: List of @mentions to include in counts (e.g. '@work', '@fruitveg', '@water', '@sleep'). These take precedence over any excluded mentions (next field). If this list is empty, all mentions will be included.

plugin.settings.title: @mentions to exclude
plugin.settings.description: List of @mentions to exclude in counts. If empty, none will be excluded.

plugin.settings.title: Weekly Stats Duration (in weeks)
plugin.settings.description: Number of weeks to look back when generating weekly stats for plotting

plugin.settings.title: Log Level
plugin.settings.description: Set how much output will be displayed for this plugin in the NotePlan > Help > Plugin Console. DEBUG is the most verbose; NONE is the least (silent).
